column3: [01/02, 16:28] We are at the gate. We are gonna miss you too. Thank you very much for everything and for being the great guy that you are Ravi, we want to thank you for your amazing tour throught Sri Lanka. You are so friendly, attentive, joyful and helped us with lots of info. You made our holliday to become the greatest and most beautiful experience of our lives. You take us as your clients and left us as friends. Bă, te iubim! (Man, we love you!) Flori & Cristi

Portraying an array of stars in full colour, it is eye-catching along the famous Boulevard. Clark Gable and Marilyn Monroe are just two featuring.Painted by Tom Suriya in 1983, it reverses the normal order of a movie theatre. Here the stars are the audience looking at us.
Walking there as when Emma Stone from the scene of movie Lalaland was walking is a good experience.Perfect spot to spot on some artists painted on the wall.Worth visiting when touring Hollywood area.

This is actually a famous mural of older hollywood stars located off of hollywood blvd. It really is a neat thing to see if nearby but I wouldn't go out of my way if you aren't already in the area. Nice to see and take pictures of if you see.

column2: Wouldn’t have travelled specifically to see it
column3: We saw this en route back to our car after waking down Hollywood Boulevard and saw it by accident. Decent mural of some of the older Hollywood legends, and we had fun trying to spot the who’s who ... worth a look if you happen across it but don’t make a special trip.

We happened to be in the area and decided to check this out. Luckily, it was just around the corner of the hotel we had lunch. It is a huge rectangular mural at the corner of Wilcox and Hollywood blvd. Coming from the east onollywood Blvd. turn left to Wilcox and it will be on the left. If you want a photo of the whole thing be there early morning. It gets pretty busy by noon with vehicle and pedestrian traffic.

This mural showed up in 2017 acclaimed hit ‘La La Land’ and was among the filming locations that I wanted to see when visiting Los Angeles.It’s a nice throwback to the Icons and Legends of the classic era of Hollywood, and while, not a must see - it’s along the boulevard and so, you don’t have to go out your way to see it and (for a photograph), be the star of the show, amongst some of the greats.

column2: Try to Name them all if you can
column3: Nice Mural me Other half and I visited on our way to Hollywood Museum about 10 mins away. Was fun to try and outscore the other on who could name the most people in the Mural. Not a must do but nice to go and see if you happen to be nearby.
I don't know whether I've seen "all" of the Hollywood murals orthe only one. It was pretty cool but I would not go out of my way to see it.
It is a nice mural to stop by and see if you are on Hollywood BLVD. But not worth going out of your way.
